means: 嫌恶的，可厌恶的，可憎的

sentence.Network_en: All terrorist crime is detestable, whoever the victims.
sentence.Network_cn: 无论受害者是谁，一切恐怖主义罪行都是可憎的。

sentence.Network_en: Selfishness is a detestable quality in anyone.
sentence.Network_cn: 自私是一种可恨的品质.

sentence.Network_en: The experience was a detestable ordeal, and it cured him of any ambitions to direct again.
sentence.Network_cn: 那次经历是一次令人厌恶的煎熬，使得他放弃了任何再当导演的想法。

PerfectNetExp.abs: detest 厌恶detestable 嫌恶的detestably 可恶地
新概念第三册51－60课笔记 @ [英语学院] ... trying adj. 气人的 detestable: 可恨的，可憎的 impress upon: 再三嘱托.
The corrupt official at once detestable and despicable ., 这个腐败的官员既可恨又可鄙.
新概念第三册51－60课笔记 @ [英语学院] ... trying adj. 气人的 detestable: 可恨的，可憎的 impress upon: 再三嘱托.

list.abs: I hate Mexican food ; She detests politicians ., 我憎恨墨西哥食物 ; 她憎恨政客.
eg . I don't love you , not at all ; the contrary , I detest you .我不爱你，一点儿也不；相反，我讨厌你。
I detest spiders ., 我讨厌蜘蛛.
I detest dirty houses ., 我厌恶肮脏的房屋.
油然而生等习语常用语的翻译 -... ... deportment 风度、举止 detest evil 嫉恶如仇 Diamond cuts diamond. 天外有天。.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin detestabilis, from the verb detestari (see detest)

entry.tran: 令人厌恶的;讨厌的;可憎的
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is detestable, you mean you dislike them very much.

example.tran: 我觉得他们的观点十分可憎。

sentences.sentence: "the most repulsive character in recent novels"
"consequences odious to those you govern"- Edmund Burke

auth_sentence.content: They were haughty and did detestable things before me.
auth_sentence.res_content: They were haughty and did detestable things before me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They were haughty and did detestable things before me.

auth_sentence.content: Destined to glut the ravenous maw of that detestable man-brute.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Destined to glut the ravenous maw of that detestable man-brute.

auth_sentence.content: To see excerpts of such detestable films, go and see "Expelled".
